custom_steps:

-App launches-

The user will receive an access gate (Xbox Live Sign In prompt screen displays)

title: Verify: Logging in to Xbox Live account at Sign In prompt, then allows access to app content
custom_preconds:
-No Xbox Live user account is signed in
-MLB.tv app is installed on the device
-Internet connection and MS Xbox Live is up and running
*Sandbox specific Xbox Live account required
custom_steps:
1. Select the MLB.TV app tile (in Apps section on Xbox dashboard)
-App launch & Xbox Live Sign in prompt displays-
2. Select Sign in
-the external MS Xbox Live Sign in app/menu opens-
3. Sign in with (*valid) Xbox Live user account
4. Attempt to access MLB app tile (UWP app does not require direct launch to app after sign-in, unfortunately)
custom_expected: App proceeds to launch.

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt in newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account is set to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send opted-in email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been tagged with opt-in group “428”.

--

Example:

Hi DB Admin,

Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters?

For the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group “428” and that the other did not.

camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in
cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in

Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help.

[Your Name]

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt out of newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account does not show an opt-in to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send the email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been NOT tagged with opt-in group “428” (which may be an invalid group but out of scope for client-side testing)

--

Example:

Hi DB Admin,

Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters?

Though there is an open issue about this group code, for the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group “428” and that the other did not.

camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in
cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in

Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help.

[Your Name]

title: ***Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations

custom_steps:

> EX:
> sudo ipfw add 1 pipe 1 src-port 80

> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 500KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 75KByte/s
> sudo ipfw delete 1
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the bitrate adapt
AND the video playback will adjust accordingly based on the connectivity of the wireless ad hoc network

custom_steps:

title: ***Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed MLB.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity using Network Link Conditioner for our Ad Hoc Network to lower the connectivity speeds
AND we throttle the network connectivity to increase the connectivity speeds
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the quality of the video adjusts in both directions in correlation with the connectivity speed

Note:  XB1 has a cache of about 30 seconds of video, so if internet connection is downgraded, lost, restored, there is a 30 second delay between the update in status and the video playback reflecting the change.
